column4: lo all. I'm tring to se my ethernet ADSL router to connect to two separate service providers at the same time. Can I do this?
not at the same time over the same phone line.

ADSL sets up an ATM connection to your ADSL providers network over the phone line. Your phone exchange routes all the ATM packets it gets from the ADSL connection to a single provider. Unless your local exchange has extra-whizzy ADSL bits that can route packets to two separate providers then you can't do what you're asking. (Unless you have two phone lines & two ADSL modems...)
to put it another way -- you can do it if your phone provider provides you with a way to do it. Don't hold your breath...
that's different. The VPN is probably tunnelled over IP.
although it could be directly tunnelled over the ATM connection with the right networking hardware at both ends
